text: <@UCX8VRBQD> Two lessons up here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/learning-center/tracks/34> Definitely lemme know what you think. More coming!

Lately when utilizing Content Staging I've noticed everything gets staged as a Landing Page. Is there a way to stage it as a Website Page instead? I don't see an option to choose Website Page...only Landing Page.

Hey guys, when transferring a blog from Wordpress to HubSpot uploading the XML file to HubSpot will take care of the post, categories, and references to the images. Do you audit the images, download, and upload to HubSpot manually, or do you just rely on the href to pull the images from the website server? What is the recommended strategy for this?

Hey <@UCDCS9KCP> we audit everything onnce it goes through. We find that depending on the type of wordpress template there can be templating language also that needs to be reviewed.

Images have worked quiet well for us but depending on your new design there might need to be some CSS overrides you do also.

So you are relying on the image references and not manually uploading featured images or image throughout individual posts? The only way you would do that is if the transfer was funky due to templating language?
featured images are spotty at best with what shows up
Okay thanks for your input!
quick q: How many subdomains can a pro account connect for landing pages?

so say they wanted to use <http://domain.com|domain.com> as the primary for the CMS/Blog/Email and then wanted to use <http://ex.domain.com|ex.domain.com> for the landing pages, this can be done on a pro plan correct?
would they then be able to create something like <http://info.domain.com|info.domain.com> and <http://ex.domain.com|ex.domain.com> both using the LPs?
4 domains total (one per content type) LP, Blog, Email, Website (if they have it)
can’t use 2 for the same content type unfortunately
ah ok
BUT, I’m like 94.99 percent sure that there’s a subdomain feature in the works to allow this… 5% confidence interval
so .01% chance I’m TOTALLY off base (do not trust my math)
i know in our agency portal we have this when i create a landing page
that why i was curious but we also have an enterprise license so i am not sure if thats just for that
That’s an enterprise feature yeah
ah ok, yea thought so
cool thanks <@U4RP6AGV9>!
